meanings.definition: An area surrounding a barn where livestock are kept.
meanings.sent1: The farmer fed the chickens in the barnyard.
meanings.sent2: The cows grazed peacefully in the barnyard.
meanings.sent3: The pig decided to throw a party in the barnyard.
meanings.sent4: The barnyard was a bustling community of animal chatter.
meanings.sent5: The children loved playing tag in the barnyard.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a barnyard.
meanings.sent1: The barnyard smell reminded him of his childhood.
meanings.sent2: The barnyard noises could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The barnyard cat was always up to mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a barnyard quality to it.
meanings.sent5: The barnyard scene was painted with vivid colors.

meanings.definition: A collection of farm animals typically found in a barnyard.
meanings.sent1: The barnyard was filled with cows, pigs, and chickens.
meanings.sent2: The children loved visiting the barnyard to see the animals.
meanings.sent3: The barnyard resembled a lively zoo.
meanings.sent4: The barnyard animals greeted the visitors with curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The barnyard at sunset was a picturesque sight.
